dataBase

Interface Rebels

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Rebelsclass

    public interface Rebels
    Author:
    Rafael Gameiro & Rui Santos

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addStormtrooper(char sign, int count, int row, int col)
      it adds a new stormtrooper to the captured stormtrooper's array;
      void Captured()
      sets the variable state to has the string CAPTURED;
      void decForce()
      decrements the value of theForce by one; if the value of theForce reaches zero, the state will change to ACTIVE; also the character stored in the variable sign will change to "R";
      void forceAwakens()
      sets the value of the variable theForce to five; sets the variable state to has the string AWAKEN; changes the character stored in the variable sign to "S";
      char getCharState() 
      int getCounter() 
      void getGun()
      it adds the value ten to the value stored in points;
      java.lang.String getName() 
      int getPoints() 
      java.lang.String getState() 
      int getXPos() 
      int getYPos() 
      boolean isAwakened()
      checks if the string of the variable state is the same as AWAKEN;
      boolean isCaptive()
      checks if the string of the variable state is the same as CAPTURED;
      Iterator<Coordenates> jediPath()
      it will iterate the path followed by the rebel;
      void move(int row, int col)
      it calls the method addCoordenates() to add the new coordinates (row,col); it sets the variable xPos to be the same as the param row; it sets the variable yPos to be the same as the param col;

    • Method Detail

      • getXPos

        int getXPos()
        Returns:
        returns the row position in the map;

      • getYPos

        int getYPos()
        Returns:
        returns the column position in the map;

      • getPoints

        int getPoints()
        Returns:
        return the total of collected points;

      • getCounter

        int getCounter()
        Returns:
        returns the total of added coordinates;

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        return the rebel's name;

      • getState

        java.lang.String getState()
        Returns:
        return the rebel's state;

      • getCharState

        char getCharState()
        Returns:
        return the rebel's character;

      • isAwakened

        boolean isAwakened()
        checks if the string of the variable state is the same as AWAKEN;
        Returns:
        returns true or false;

      • isCaptive

        boolean isCaptive()
        checks if the string of the variable state is the same as CAPTURED;
        Returns:
        returns true or false;

      • Captured

        void Captured()
        sets the variable state to has the string CAPTURED;

      • getGun

        void getGun()
        it adds the value ten to the value stored in points;

      • forceAwakens

        void forceAwakens()
        sets the value of the variable theForce to five; sets the variable state to has the string AWAKEN; changes the character stored in the variable sign to "S";

      • decForce

        void decForce()
        decrements the value of theForce by one; if the value of theForce reaches zero, the state will change to ACTIVE; also the character stored in the variable sign will change to "R";

      • move

        void move(int row,
          int col)
        it calls the method addCoordenates() to add the new coordinates (row,col); it sets the variable xPos to be the same as the param row; it sets the variable yPos to be the same as the param col;
        Parameters:
        row - row position in the map;
        col - column position in the map;

      • addStormtrooper

        void addStormtrooper(char sign,
                     int count,
                     int row,
                     int col)
        it adds a new stormtrooper to the captured stormtrooper's array;
        Parameters:
        sign - character that belongs to stormtrooper;
        count - serial number of the stormtrooper;
        row - row position in the map;
        col - column position in the map;

      • jediPath

        Iterator<Coordenates> jediPath()
        it will iterate the path followed by the rebel;
        Returns:
        return the object of an iterator;
